newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Chinese said easing off Argentine soyoil purchases.
newsitem.headline: Chinese said easing off Argentine soyoil purchases.

text.p: Chinese buyers eased off buying Argentine soybean oil Thursday, but traders confirmed talk of a big recent sale to Iran.
"I think it was about a week ago. It would have been at about $554 tonne FOB, for June and July shipment. I think the deal was secret," one trader said.
Another trader had said Wednesday that Iran had bought soyoil at $540 FOB for July shipment Tuesday, and 25,000 tonnes for June shipment at $555 Monday.
But traders said that the big Chinese interest of recent days had faded.
"We started seeing the Chinese two days ago. But they are more reluctant to buy for the moment," one said.
Another said, "There may have been 50,000 tonnes of oil sold over the past few days. But the demand has fallen off a bit now."
One trader said the Chinese interest may have been diverted by falls in nearby soybean prices in Chicago.
